thread.title: No. 8 Alabama wins defensive struggle with Tennessee
thread.title_full: No. 8 Alabama wins defensive struggle with Tennessee

author: Jordan Smith
title: No. 8 Alabama wins defensive struggle with Tennessee
text:
No. 8 Alabama wins defensive struggle with Tennessee Posted: Updated: Saturday, October 24 2015 7:36 PM EDT 2015-10-24 23:36:36 GMT Some weeks Alabama looks like they can beat anybody on its schedule and some weeks it's a struggle for the Crimson Tide to even score. More >> Some weeks Alabama looks like they can beat anybody on its schedule and some weeks it's a struggle for the Crimson Tide to even score. More >> Updated: Friday, October 23 2015 9:57 PM EDT 2015-10-24 01:57:59 GMT There's a quiet desperation at play in the SEC this week, with seasons on the line and future showdowns looming. More >> There's a quiet desperation at play in the SEC this week, with seasons on the line and future showdowns looming. More >> The University of Alabama has shared funeral arrangements for former tailback Altee Tenpenny. More >> SPORTS Updated: Wednesday, October 21 2015 11:34 PM EDT 2015-10-22 03:34:13 GMT Former Alabama running back Altee Tenpenny died Tuesday evening from injuries suffered in a one-car accident in Glen Allan, Mississippi. More >> Former Alabama running back Altee Tenpenny died Tuesday evening from injuries suffered in a one-car accident in Glen Allan, Mississippi. More >> News Tuesday, October 20 2015 7:11 PM EDT 2015-10-20 23:11:13 GMT You know about the University of Alabama's excellence on the football field. More >> You know about the University of Alabama's excellence on the football field. More >> TUSCALOOSA, AL (WBRC) - 
Some weeks Alabama looks like they can beat anybody on its schedule and some weeks it's a struggle for the Crimson Tide to even score. 
Fortunately for Tennessee, Alabama struggle to score on Saturday. But the Vols left nine points on the field thanks to three missed field goals and suffered a 19-14 loss to the No. 8 Crimson Tide. It’s the ninth straight year the Tide has topped the Vols. 
UT opened the game with an 11-play drive but missed a field goal from 43 yards out. 
Derrick Henry crossed the goal line first on a 20-yard run and gave Alabama a 7-0 lead in the first quarter. 
The Vols answered on their next drive with an 11-yard touchdown pass from Josh Dobbs to Josh Smith. 
UT had the chance to hold a slim lead at halftime. But the Vols missed a field goal from 51 yards away as time expired. 
Adam Griffith capped off Bama’s first drive of the second half with a 19-yard field goal. It gave Alabama a 10-7 lead. 
UT saw yet another promising drive end on an unsuccessful field goal attempt in the final quarter, again from 51-yards out. 
Griffith entered to add another field goal from 28 yards out. 
But Tennessee answered with a 12-yard run by Jalen Hurd. It gave the Vols their first lead of the game. 
Henry gave Bama the lead again with 2:24 remaining on a 14-yard run. He rushed for 148 yards on 28 carries. 
Tennesse's final drive was plagued by a penalty and two sacks. The final sack sent the ball flying from Dobbs' hands into the hands of A’Shawn Robinson. 
Senior quarterback Jake Coker entered the game to take a knee and run out the clock. 
Coker threw for 247 yards. He completed 21-of-27 passes, but also threw an interception. 
The Crimson Tide (7-1, 4-1 SEC) will enjoy its bye week next weekend. They return to action Nov. 7 at home against undefeated LSU.
